ActorTalk: I already reported the issue before you woke up. The producers from the WGAA promised to compensate us properly.
Yes, it's good to be back.
No more origami clovers, and no more ending up in strange places either.
The terminal shows it's the next day, so the loop must be over, right?
Yes. So for now, just rest, Commandant. You're safe.
With you here, I already feel more relaxed. I think I'll be fine.
Then take your time to rest.
Ding! File sent. Please check your inbox. Reminder: the Dreamweaver data storage is time-limited.
When I woke up, I saw that we were both still wearing the Dreamweaver.
Something must've gone wrong while we were using it together. Our consciousness got trapped inside.
But it's alright now. We're both back in the real world, Commandant.
Please finish selecting your photos and submit your feedback within the required time for final processing...
That's from the staff. They checked in before you woke up and offered to print the photos we took in the Dreamweaver world... as a gift for helping with their test.
They suggested it while retrieving the device. It's been upgradedâ€”it can now read and digitize memories directly from the brain.
They also promised this kind of malfunction won't happen again.
And they offered to digitize the memory of this whole experience for us, free of charge.
We've selected quite a few. Let's make a shared album and put them all in there.
Yes. We can take more photos in our daily lives too, and keep them all in that album.
That way, we'll have a Dreamweaver world of our own.
Good thing I'm still on vacation today.
So, what exactly was that "time loop" all about?
Glad we made it back.
I'm filing a complaint!
Well, at least we got something out of it.
A pleasant surprise, huh?
Then let's start picking the photos?
